translated: The thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha Bhadradeva knew that the monk Dhṛtimati had perfected the perfection of diligence, and he therefore gave him a Dharma teaching on the perfection of diligence.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: It is not possessing nirvāṇa.

original: ye shes dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: ye shes dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: It is not possessing wisdom.

original: ye shes ma yin pa dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: ye shes ma yin pa dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: It is not associated with wisdom.

original: sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /🔽sangs rgyas ma yin pa dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'ang ma yin / sangs rgyas ma yin pa dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: It is not associated with buddhahood.🔽It is not associated with what is not buddhahood.

original: rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: It is not associated with pratyekabuddhas.

original: rang sangs rgyas ma yin pa dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas ma yin pa dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: It is not associated with what is not a pratyekabuddha.

original: nyan thos dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: nyan thos dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: It is not associated with śrāvakas.

original: nyan thos ma yin pa dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: nyan thos ma yin pa dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: It is not associated with what is not a śrāvaka.

original: so so'i skye bo dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: It is not associated with ordinary beings.

original: so so'i skye bo ma yin pa dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo ma yin pa dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: It is not associated with what is not an ordinary being.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: It is not associated with concepts.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa'ang ma bskyed de /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa'ang ma bskyed de /
translated: It does not generate the concepts associated with the absence of concepts.

original: 'du shes thams cad dang bral ba'i ting nge 'dzin bsgoms /
analyzed: 'du shes thams cad dang bral ba'i ting nge 'dzin bsgoms /
translated: It cultivates the samādhi that is free from all concepts.

original: rtog pa dang bral ba'i ting nge 'dzin bsgoms nas dge ba'i rtsa ba des sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la nam yang bsnyen bkur ma byas par ma gyur te /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bral ba'i ting nge 'dzin bsgoms nas dge ba'i rtsa ba des sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la nam yang bsnyen bkur ma byas par ma gyur te /
translated: Having cultivated samādhi free from discursive thought, through that root of merit he never failed to serve and attend to the blessed buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong brjod du med pa la bsnyen bkur byas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong brjod du med pa la bsnyen bkur byas /
translated: He served and attended to inexpressibly many quintillions of buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag thams cad @360a *//
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag thams cad @360a *//
translated: He served and attended to all those blessed buddhas.

original: la des g-yog dang / bsnyen bkur byas pas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin la bsnyen cing bsgoms te mang du byas pas de phyin chad bskal pa brjod du med pa'i bar du sangs rgyas med pa'i zhing du nam yang ma skyes /
analyzed: la des g-yog dang / bsnyen bkur byas pas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin la bsnyen cing bsgoms te mang du byas pas de phyin chad bskal pa brjod du med pa'i bar du sangs rgyas med pa'i zhing du nam yang ma skyes /
translated: By serving and attending to them, he approached, cultivated, and increased the samādhi of the emptiness of the nonapprehending nature. From then on, for inexpressibly many eons he never took birth in a realm without a buddha.

original: nam yang zhing du 'du shes dang / sangs rgyas su 'du shes kyang ma skyes /
analyzed: nam yang zhing du 'du shes dang / sangs rgyas su 'du shes kyang ma skyes /
translated: He never took birth with the perception of a realm or the perception of a buddha.

original: nam yang byang chub kyi sems rgyun du mi 'byung bar ma gyur /
analyzed: nam yang byang chub kyi sems rgyun du mi 'byung bar ma gyur /
translated: He never failed to continuously have the mind set on awakening.

original: rtag tu rgyun mi chad par sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur dang g-yog byas /
analyzed: rtag tu rgyun mi chad par sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur dang g-yog byas /
translated: They constantly and continuously served and attended to the blessed buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du sprul pas sems can rnams yongs su smin par byas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du sprul pas sems can rnams yongs su smin par byas /
translated: They emanated in all the buddha realms and brought sentient beings to full maturity.

original: gang dang gang du sprul pa sprul pa de dang de na sems can rnams kyis sangs rgyas byung ba snyam du shes te /
analyzed: gang dang gang du sprul pa sprul pa de dang de na sems can rnams kyis sangs rgyas byung ba snyam du shes te /
translated: Wherever they emanated, sentient beings there understood that a buddha had appeared.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul rnam pa du mas sems can de dag la ston to //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul rnam pa du mas sems can de dag la ston to //
translated: They taught those sentient beings through many kinds of miraculous displays.

original: gang deng gang du sprul pa sprul pa de dang der sems can ji lta bu la mos pa de lta bur sprul pa sprul te 'dul ba'i sems can rnams kyi rgyud dang sbyar te rnam par 'dul ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing du sprul pa rnam pa du🔽mar sprul to //
analyzed: gang deng gang du sprul pa sprul pa de dang der sems can ji lta bu la mos pa de lta bur sprul pa sprul te 'dul ba'i sems can rnams kyi rgyud dang sbyar te rnam par 'dul ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing du sprul pa rnam pa du mar sprul to //
translated: Wherever they emanated, they emanated in accordance with the aspirations of sentient beings. In order to tame sentient beings, they emanated in the buddha realms in various ways.

original: sprul pa de dag gis kyang gzhan yang sprul te bstan to; ;'jam dpal /
analyzed: sprul pa de dag gis kyang gzhan yang sprul te bstan to; ;'jam dpal /
translated: Those emanations also emanated and taught others.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dper na / sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa mngon par sprul te /
analyzed: dper na / sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa mngon par sprul te /
translated: a magician conjures up emanations,

original: sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa de dag gis kyang sprul pa gzhan mngon par sprul pa @360b de bzhin du /
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa de dag gis kyang sprul pa gzhan mngon par sprul pa @360b de bzhin du /
translated: and those emanations conjured up by the magician also emanate further emanations.

original: 'jam dpal / dge slong snyan pa'i sgra dbyangs kyis kyang sprul pa mngon par sprul te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dge slong snyan pa'i sgra dbyangs kyis kyang sprul pa mngon par sprul te /
translated: In the same way, Mañjuśrī, the monk Śrīghoṣa also emanated emanations,

original: sprul pa de dag gis kyang gzhan mngon par sprul to //
analyzed: sprul pa de dag gis kyang gzhan mngon par sprul to //
translated: and those emanations also emanated further emanations.

original: 'jam dpal / de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de ji snyam du sems /
translated: Mañjuśrī, what do you think about this?

original: de'i tshe de'i dus na dge slong snyan pa'i sgra dbyangs zhes bya bar gyur pa de gzhan zhig yin pa snyam du 'dzin na /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus na dge slong snyan pa'i sgra dbyangs zhes bya bar gyur pa de gzhan zhig yin pa snyam du 'dzin na /
translated: Do you think that the one who was the monk named Śrīghoṣa at that time, on that occasion, was anyone else?

original: 'jam dpal / khyod kyis de ltar mi blta'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / khyod kyis de ltar mi blta'o //
translated: Mañjuśrī, you should not see it like that.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na; de bzhin gshegs pa don thams cad grub pa de de'i tshe de'i dus na dge slong snyan pa'i sgra dbyangs zhes bya bar gyur to //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na; de bzhin gshegs pa don thams cad grub pa de de'i tshe de'i dus na dge slong snyan pa'i sgra dbyangs zhes bya bar gyur to //
translated: And why? Because the Tathāgata Sarvārthasiddha was at that time, on that occasion, the monk named Śrīghoṣa.

original: 'jam dpal / de lta bas na /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de lta bas na /
translated: Mañjuśrī, therefore

original: sgrib pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin la bsten par bya /
analyzed: sgrib pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin la bsten par bya /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices the liberation that is free from obscurations should rely on the samādhi that is the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.

original: bsgom par bya /
analyzed: bsgom par bya /
translated: He should cultivate it.

original: mang du bya'o //
analyzed: mang du bya'o //
translated: He should do it a lot.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid 'di'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la 'byung ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid 'di'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la 'byung ngo //
translated: This bodhisattva samādhi of the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities arises for the bodhisattva who possesses the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'jam dpal / sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na bskal pa tshad med /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na bskal pa tshad med /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the past, immeasurable,

original: grangs med / bsam gyis mi khyab /
analyzed: grangs med / bsam gyis mi khyab /
translated: incalculable, inconceivable,

original: mtshungs pa med /
analyzed: mtshungs pa med /
translated: incomparable,

original: gzhal du med /
analyzed: gzhal du med /
translated: immeasurable,

original: brjod du med pa de'i pha rol gyi'ang ches pha rol na bskal pa'i snying po zhes bya ba'i bskal pa byung ste /
analyzed: brjod du med pa de'i pha rol gyi'ang ches pha rol na bskal pa'i snying po zhes bya ba'i bskal pa byung ste /
translated: and inexpressible numbers of eons ago, beyond that, there was an eon called Essence of Eons.

original: bskal pa'i snying po'i bskal pa de la de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa /🔽@361a *// bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: bskal pa'i snying po'i bskal pa de la de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa / @361a *// bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, during that eon called Essence of Eons, there appeared in the world a thus-gone one, a worthy one, a perfect buddha, someone with perfect knowledge and conduct, a blissful one,

original: 'jig rten mkhyen pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten mkhyen pa /
translated: a knower of the world,

original: skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba bla na med pa /
analyzed: skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba bla na med pa /
translated: a charioteer who tames people, an unsurpassed one,

original: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mtshungs pa med pa'i gzi brjid 'od ces bya ba 'jig rten du byung ste /
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mtshungs pa med pa'i gzi brjid 'od ces bya ba 'jig rten du byung ste /
translated: a teacher of gods and humans, a blessed buddha called Incomparable Splendor.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa mtshungs pa med pa'i gzi brjid 'od de'i 'od kyis shar phyogs su gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams snang bar gyur /🔽lho phyogs su gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams snang bar gyur /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa mtshungs pa med pa'i gzi brjid 'od de'i 'od kyis shar phyogs su gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams snang bar gyur / lho phyogs su gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams snang bar gyur /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the light of the thus-gone one Incomparable Splendor illuminated world systems in the east equal to the number of grains of sand in the Ganges River.🔽It illuminated world systems in the south equal to the number of grains of sand in the Ganges River.

original: nub phyogs su gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams snang bar gyur /
analyzed: nub phyogs su gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams snang bar gyur /
translated: It illuminated world systems in the west equal to the number of grains of sand in the Ganges River.

original: byang phyogs su gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams snang bar gyur /
analyzed: byang phyogs su gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams snang bar gyur /
translated: The light shone to worlds as numerous as the sands of the Ganges in the northern direction.

original: de bzhin du shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / byang shar dang / steng dang / 'og dang / phyogs bcu kun tu phyogs re rer yang gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams de bzhin gshegs pa mtshungs pa med pa'i gzi brjid 'od de'i 'od kyis snang bar gyur to //
analyzed: de bzhin du shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / byang shar dang / steng dang / 'og dang / phyogs bcu kun tu phyogs re rer yang gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams de bzhin gshegs pa mtshungs pa med pa'i gzi brjid 'od de'i 'od kyis snang bar gyur to //
translated: Similarly, in the southeast, southwest, northwest, northeast, above, below, and in all ten directions, in each direction, the light of the Thus-Gone Incomparable Splendor extended to worlds as numerous as the sands of the Ganges.

original: sems can gang de'i 'od kyis reg pa de dag thams cad kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par gyur to //
analyzed: sems can gang de'i 'od kyis reg pa de dag thams cad kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par gyur to //
translated: All beings touched by that light became irreversible from unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mtshungs pa med pa'i gzi brjid 'od de'i 'jig rten gyi khams na byang chub sems dpa' gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed rnams phyir mi @361b ldog pa'i theg pa la yang dag par zhugs par gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mtshungs pa med pa'i gzi brjid 'od de'i 'jig rten gyi khams na byang chub sems dpa' gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed rnams phyir mi @361b ldog pa'i theg pa la yang dag par zhugs par gyur te /
translated: In the world system of the thus-gone Incomparable Splendor, as many bodhisattvas as there are grains of sand in the Ganges had entered the irreversible vehicle.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas byang chub sems dpa' de dag phal cher bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can brjod du med pa rnams theg pa gsum gyis rab tu
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas byang chub sems dpa' de dag phal cher bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can brjod du med pa rnams theg pa gsum gyis rab tu
translated: After that thus-gone one passed into parinirvāṇa, most of those bodhisattvas fully awakened to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood and established countless beings in the three vehicles.

original: 'god do // yang de'i tshe de'i dus na sangs rgyas kyi zhing de na dge slong sbrin gyi rgyal po zhes bya ba zhig byung ste /
analyzed: 'god do // yang de'i tshe de'i dus na sangs rgyas kyi zhing de na dge slong sbrin gyi rgyal po zhes bya ba zhig byung ste /
translated: At that time, in that buddha realm there was a monk called Cloud King.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams de na byang chub sems dpa' ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad kyi mchog byed de /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams de na byang chub sems dpa' ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad kyi mchog byed de /
translated: He was the foremost of all the bodhisattvas in that world system.

original: des byang chub sems dpa' de dag thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de dag gi dam pa'i chos dus dang po dang / bar ma dang / tha ma gsum du gzung ngo //
analyzed: des byang chub sems dpa' de dag thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de dag gi dam pa'i chos dus dang po dang / bar ma dang / tha ma gsum du gzung ngo //
translated: He will uphold the true Dharma of all those bodhisattvas who have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood, during the three periods of their Dharma: the first, the middle, and the last.

original: zhes de ltar smon lam btab bo //
analyzed: zhes de ltar smon lam btab bo //
translated: He will make such aspirations.

original: 'jam dpal / de na byang chub sems dpa' de dag thams cad dus ji lta ba bzhin du so so'i 'jig rten gyi khams su bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te sems can dpag tu med cing brjod du med pa
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de na byang chub sems dpa' de dag thams cad dus ji lta ba bzhin du so so'i 'jig rten gyi khams su bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te sems can dpag tu med cing brjod du med pa
translated: Mañjuśrī, all those bodhisattvas will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood in their respective world systems at the appropriate times, and will benefit countless, inexpressibly

original: rnams kyi don byas nas phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su mya ngan las 'das so //
analyzed: rnams kyi don byas nas phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su mya ngan las 'das so //
translated: numerous sentient beings, and then pass into parinirvāṇa in the realm of nirvāṇa without any remainder of the aggregates.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad kyi dam pa'i chos dge slong sprin gyi rgyal po des dus thog ma dang / bar ma dang / tha ma gsum du bzung ngo //🔽de dag mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu 'jig rten du @362a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad kyi dam pa'i chos dge slong sprin gyi rgyal po des dus thog ma dang / bar ma dang / tha ma gsum du bzung ngo // de dag mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu 'jig rten du @362a *//
translated: That bhikṣu Megha­dhupa­rāja retained the Dharma of all those tathāgatas in the beginning, the middle, and the end.🔽After they had passed into nirvāṇa,

original: snyigs ma lnga byung ste /
analyzed: snyigs ma lnga byung ste /
translated: the five degenerations arose in the world.

original: sems can skal ba med par gyur nas dam pa'i chos nub pa de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' de phyi rol gyi drang srong mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan par gyur te /
analyzed: sems can skal ba med par gyur nas dam pa'i chos nub pa de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' de phyi rol gyi drang srong mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan par gyur te /
translated: When beings became unfortunate and the Dharma was disappearing, that bodhisattva became an external ṛṣi with the five higher perceptions.

original: de bstan bcos gang 'jig rten gyi don du 'gyur ba chos dang ldan pa de khong du chud nas rab tu ston pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bstan bcos gang 'jig rten gyi don du 'gyur ba chos dang ldan pa de khong du chud nas rab tu ston pa 'di lta ste /
translated: He understood and taught the treatises that were in accord with the Dharma and were for the benefit of the world.

original: snyan tshig gi rig byed dang / nges brjod kyi rig byed dang / mchod sbyin gyi rig byed dang / srid srung gi rig byed dang / sgra'i bstan bcos rnams dang / gtan tshigs kyi bstan bcos rnams dang / gso ba'i bstan bcos rnams dang /
analyzed: snyan tshig gi rig byed dang / nges brjod kyi rig byed dang / mchod sbyin gyi rig byed dang / srid srung gi rig byed dang / sgra'i bstan bcos rnams dang / gtan tshigs kyi bstan bcos rnams dang / gso ba'i bstan bcos rnams dang /
translated: He taught the Vedas of poetry, the Vedas of ritual, the Vedas of astronomy, the Vedas of medicine, the treatises on grammar, the treatises on logic, the treatises on healing,

original: nor sbyar dang / dug dang / sngags dang / sman gyi rgyud dang / dus 'khor ba dang / dus dang / gza' dang / rgyu skar shes pa'ang rab tu ston to //
analyzed: nor sbyar dang / dug dang / sngags dang / sman gyi rgyud dang / dus 'khor ba dang / dus dang / gza' dang / rgyu skar shes pa'ang rab tu ston to //
translated: the treatises on the arts, the treatises on poisons, the treatises on mantras, the treatises on medicine, the treatises on astrology, the treatises on the movements of the stars, the treatises on the movements of the planets, and the treatises on the movements of the constellations.

original: sems can rnams la phan pa dang ldan pa'i bzo'i gnas thams cad kyang ston to //
analyzed: sems can rnams la phan pa dang ldan pa'i bzo'i gnas thams cad kyang ston to //
translated: He taught all the crafts that are useful to sentient beings.

original: nam sangs rgyas byung ba de na de'i 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal por gyur te /
analyzed: nam sangs rgyas byung ba de na de'i 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal por gyur te /
translated: Whenever a buddha appeared, he became a universal monarch in his retinue.

original: rgyal po'i srid bor nas 'khor dang bcas te khyim nas khyim med par rab tu byung ngo //
analyzed: rgyal po'i srid bor nas 'khor dang bcas te khyim nas khyim med par rab tu byung ngo //
translated: He gave up his kingdom and, together with his retinue, went forth from home to homelessness.

original: rab tu byung nas de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gis bstan pa'ang kun 'dzin /
analyzed: rab tu byung nas de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gis bstan pa'ang kun 'dzin /
translated: Having gone forth, he upheld the teachings of those thus-gone ones.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa de dag gi ring bsrel la'ang mchod pa rnam pa mang pos rab tu sbyor bar gyur to /🔽skye bo'i tshogs dpag tu med pa rnams sangs rgyas  mchod pa byed du 'jug par gyur /

analyzed: brjod du med pa de'i pha rol gyi'ang ches pha rol na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa /

translated: Mañjuśrī, in the teachings of the thus-gone Boundless Splendor, there was a monk called Mind of Perfect Peace who had planted roots of virtue with countless billions of buddhas.

analyzed: de nas dge slong rab tu zhi ba'i blo gros de bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa gzi brjid dpag med ga la ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das de'i zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
translated: Then the monk Praśāntamati went to the place where the blessed thus-gone Amitatejas was. When he arrived, he bowed his head to the feet of that blessed one and sat to one side.

analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas dge slong rab tu zhi ba'i blo gros des de bzhin gshegs pa gzi brjid dpag med la 'di skad ces gsol to //

analyzed: rab tu zhi ba'i blo gros /

original: sbyin pa'i ngo bo nyid med par khong du chud par bya /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i ngo bo nyid med par khong du chud par bya /

original: len pa'i ngo bo nyid med par khong du chud par bya /🔽sbyin bdag ngo bo nyid med par khong du chud par bya; sbyin gnas ngo bo nyid med par khong du chud par bya /🔽sbyin gnas mchod pa ngo bo nyid med par khong du chud par bya /

original: bsngo ba ngo bo nyid med par khong du chud par bya /
analyzed: bsngo ba ngo bo nyid med par khong du chud par bya /
translated: He should understand that the nature of the dedication of offerings is non-entityness.🔽He should understand that the nature of the dedication is non-entityness.

original: gang bsngo ba de'ang ngo bo nyid med par khong du chud par bya /
analyzed: gang bsngo ba de'ang ngo bo nyid med par khong du chud par bya /

analyzed: gang du bsngo ba dang gang gis bsngo ba de'ang ngo bo nyid med par khong du chud par bya'o //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽sbyin pa ni /

original: sbyin gnas kyang sbyin gnas kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo //🔽sbyin pa'i 'bras bu'ang sbyin pa'i @371b 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: sbyin gnas kyang sbyin gnas kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo // sbyin pa'i 'bras bu'ang sbyin pa'i @371b 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo //

original: bsngo ba'ang bsngo ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: bsngo ba'ang bsngo ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo //

original: byang chub kyang byang chub kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub kyang byang chub kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo //

original: de ltar stong pa nyid la mos pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar stong pa nyid la mos pa ni /
translated: Thus, one who is inspired by emptiness

analyzed: bya ba tshad med pa'i bsam pas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag par 'gyur te /

analyzed: sbyin pa de'ang pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming thob cing 'bags pa med par 'gyur ro //

original: rab tu zhi ba'i blo gros; 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab tu zhi ba'i blo gros; 'di lta ste /
translated: Praśāntamati, it is like this:

analyzed: dper na / sgyu ma mkhan gyis bud med rin po che mngon par sprul na /

analyzed: de'ang bud med rin po che'i grangs su 'gro mod kyi /

original: de la bud med rin po che'i ming ma dmigs pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: de la bud med rin po che'i ming ma dmigs pa de bzhin du /

original: rab tu zhi ba'i blo gros /

analyzed: sbyin pa la sbyin pa'i ngo bo nyid mi dmigs mod kyi /

analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su'ang 'gro /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i grangs su'ang 'gro'o //

original: rab tu zhi ba'i blo gros /
